snippet: A marketing agency, BBH, caused a stir when it hired homeless people to walk around carrying Wi-Fi devices, offering Internet access in exchange for donations. As word of the project spread on the ground and online, it hit a nerve among many who said...
abstract: A marketing agency, BBH, caused a stir when it hired homeless people to walk around carrying Wi-Fi devices, offering Internet access in exchange for donations. As word of the project spread on the ground and online, it hit a nerve among many who said that turning down-and-out people into wireless towers was exploitative and discomfiting.

headline.main: Daily Report: A SXSW Stunt Backfires on Marketer
